answers.text: a fusion of the literature of both developmental and intervention sciences

qas.question: What are some of the negative things adolescents are susceptible to?

answers.text: drug addiction, sexual abuse, peer pressure, violent crimes and other illegal activities

qas.question: What does the DIS focus on in adolescents?

context: At the decision-making point of their lives, youth is susceptible to <a1_0>drug addiction, sexual abuse, peer pressure, violent crimes and other illegal activities<a1_0/>. Developmental Intervention Science (DIS) is <a0_0>a fusion of the literature of both developmental and intervention sciences<a0_0/>. This association conducts youth interventions that mutually assist both the needs of the community as well as psychologically stranded youth by focusing on <a2_0>risky and inappropriate behaviors<a2_0/> while promoting positive self-development along with self-esteem among adolescents.
